events.name: Open Space: Lean Kanban
events.description: This is an open space forum where everyone generates topics, votes for topics, contributes. http://www.openspaceworld.org/files/tmnfiles/2pageos.htm You will need to change your ID card at the gantry downstairs. Come up to 7th floor. Ring/text[masked], if you are stuck at the glass door. Room: Obon & Thanksgiving rooms Refreshment at 7:00 PM  Topic generating: 7:30 PM
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore 038985

events.name: Digital Health trends today and beyond
events.description:
Updated again - those who can't attend for whatever reason can call in via conference below. You have been invited to a join.me online meeting Join the meeting: https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Fjoin.me%2Fgrantatvalidic&usd=2&usg=AFQjCNHVHlrG2DWnapPw0Yh_EcULTaqrng On a computer, use any browser. Nothing to download.On a phone or tablet, launch the join.me app (https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Fjoin.me%2Fapp&usd=2&usg=AFQjCNHUCSzEctv449B1TCR1Fkvr8Ln-Bw) and enter meeting code: grantatvalidic We have our projectors now - Thank you Shamini and Mei Yi.. Here are the bios and synopsis of the speakers - Grant and Sally, Ben, Michael and Mei YI! Here is Ee Bin's contact details  - mobile (65) 91454556. any messages you can send to the meetup messenger. Thanks! Proposed Schedule7 - 7.20pm - Arrival and self-intro 7.20 - 7.40 Grant + questions 7.40 - 8.00 Sally + questions 8.00 - 8.20 Ben + questions 8.20 - 8.40 Michael and Mei + questions 8.40 onwards mingle and conclude the evening The Venue - Singapore Council of Women's Organisations (SCWO),  96 Waterloo Street. Map's on the Location. It's a building on its own with a small café (Paper Crane Café) on the  right side  and our meeting room is on the ground level just past the reception counter - can't get any easier than that! I'll be providing drinks (non-booze, some beer an one bottle, and water) .. encouraged to buy food from the café (they are not yet 3 months old https://www.facebook.com/papercranesg) For those who are driving, please find your own parking When you enter  the building, I hope to be able to put up a Meetup sign so that you know where it is. There'll be a sign in sheet and a dropbox for your business card/personal card .. so please fill that up and drop the card in the box. Thanks! 


Grant's Bio:  Grant Boyadjian is a Director of Business Development at Validic, the healthcare industry's leading platform for digital health data. Prior to joining Validic, he worked at Sg2 and Navigant Consulting, where he provided strategy consulting services to large hospitals, health systems, and IDNs in the US. Most recently, he earned his MBA from the Duke Fuqua School of Business and now spearheads international expansion efforts at Validic. Presentation synopsis: During our presentation, Validic would like to provide an overview of who we are, discuss the many challenges facing the healthcare industry (both in the US and internationally), and share how Validic's solution is helping to address these challenges with an integrated digital health platform. Grant will be calling in from the US, so this is truly appreciated! 


Sally's Bio: Sally May Tan holds the unique credentials of a CEO turned Wellness Coach, who is truly passionate to support her clients in their pursuit of a life of success that is brimming with real energy, great health and true happiness. Having enjoyed a long and illustrious career in numerous global and regional leadership roles in multinational corporations, Sally has channelled her passion to inspire, educate and empower her clients to redefine their versionof success.  She graduated with a Masters in Counselling Psychology, holds a Bachelors degree in Business Administration (with Honours) and is also certified Holistic Wellness and PH360 Coach. Presentation synopsis: In an age where humanity seeks answers at both the cellular level and it’s conscious counterpart, Personal Health is rapidly becoming the benchmark as we move further into the excitement and unknown of 21st century Medicine. The advancements in Functional Medicine, the insights from Personal Genomics & Epigenetics, the shift from general science to Personalised Health, and the wisdom of Ancient Medicine, combined with the latest biotechnologies all hold an integral importance in  the ultimate understanding of the intricate art that is the human body. We will be exploring the space where cutting edge health sciences meet personal health,  making available the ultimate tool for advancing your wellness!...  Ben's Bio Ben has been an Orthopaedic Practitioner and Physical Therapist for 17 years. Ben has led Transformation Projects in Healthcare in UK and currently works as a Technical Lead for an IT Project in the National Health Service in UK. Special interests include Big Data and Predictive Analytics in Healthcare and its applications. Ben is also a writer, photographer and a Radio Broadcaster and above all a fantastic cook. Curry anyone? Presentation synopsis: The presentation is about Predictive Analytics, the current trends and applications and its application in Medicine/Healthcare, and the future of Health Technology should be do put together an application that looks at the flaws of earlier designs and to design an application that can determine best outcomes. 


Michael and Mei Yi's Bio: Michael is a San Francisco native. Trained as a software engineer, he is looking to make the transition from pure tech into healthcare. Previously, he has worked at two healthcare companies in Counsyl & Verily. Mei Yi is a final year student from NTU who specializes in both business and engineering. She also has experiences working as UI designer in several US hackathons. She is interested to explore ways to support cancer patients from the non-medical aspect. Both of them are in process of developing PatientConnect now. Presentation Synopsis:  In this presentation, we will discuss our current project PatientConnect, a virtual support network for cancer patients. We will talk about our motivation and vision behind PatientConnect, what we have learnt from talking to different stakeholders involved and challenges that lie ahead. See you soon. Cheers :-)
events.location: SCWO (Singapore Council of Women's Organizations) 	, 96 Waterloo Street 187987

events.name: Haskell.SG - February meetup
events.description: This will be our first meetup in 2016. • "Using the GHC API - my experience in writing ghc-imported-from" - by Carlo Hamalainen. • "Getting up to speed with servant" - Denis Redozubov •  "Managing Haskell API evolution" - Michal J. Gajda (tentative) Don't forget to bring Your job announcements here!
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore
